alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North Itasca; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 7:29PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM MONDAY TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 9 inches. * WHERE...South Itasca, North Itasca and Central St. Louis Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bois Forte Band, Deer Creek and, Lake Vermilion areas. * WHEN...From 3 AM Monday to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a prolonged event with two separate waves, one Monday and the second Tuesday. The second wave should be less impactful to the Iron Range. There will be a sharp snowfall gradient from north to south across these counties. The snow should be dry and fluffy.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North Itasca; South Itasca
